programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 12 Tigers seek a 10th straight win over the Yellow Jackets in this match from Bobby Dodd Stadium. Clemson doubled up Georgia Tech 42-21 behind four TD passes from Cade Klubnik on Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia Tech leads the all-time series 51-36-2.

programme.desc: The Owls face the No. 18 Yellow Jackets at Bobby Dodd Stadium. Georgia Tech is off to its first 3-0 start since 2016 after upsetting then-No. 12 Clemson 24-21 at home Sept. 13. Jackets quarterback Haynes King ran for 103 yards and a TD in the win.

programme.title: College Football

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: Drama. Spencer Tracy stars as an unfairly unpopular priest living on a volcanic South Sea island which is about to erupt. With Kerwin Matthews, Frank Sinatra and Barbara Luna.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: Sci-fi action. Mark Wahlberg discovers that his hallucinations are memories from past lives. There are others like him, but they don't all have good intentions..

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: Outrageous satirical comedy from the South Park team. A crack team of puppets battle to save the world from an evil terrorist plot hatched by North Korean leader Kim Jong Il.

programme.title: Antwone Fisher

programme.title: The Swimmer

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande

programme.title: Fresh

programme.title: The Man from Colorado
programme.desc: Western. When a sadistic Union colonel (Glenn Ford) becomes a federal judge after the Civil War, his friend (William Holden) takes the deputy job to try and temper his actions.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets

programme.title: Titanic

programme.title: The Contractor

programme.title: How to Blow Up a Pipeline

programme.title: Woman at War
programme.desc: Dark comedy with Halldóra Geirhardsdóttir. A choir teacher living in a small town in Iceland has a secret identity: 'Mountain Woman', a human-sized eco-superhero. In Icelandic/subs.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Jasper, Alabama, was, for the longest time, a coal mining town. Father-and-son stories from the Johnson and Evans families help the crew see what has changed and what has remained. Two restaurants serve as the lodestars: At Brown's Deli and Package Store they bake biscuits and sells half-pints. Across town at Bayou Fresh Seafood, Zhu Jianjun and his crew serve spicy tuna rolls and fried pickles.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Arkansas (2-1) at Memphis (3-0). From Simmons Bank Liberty Stadium.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Auburn (3-0) at Oklahoma (3-0) in an SEC opener. From Memorial Stadium in Norman. Tigers RB Jeremiah Cobb has already matches his rushing total (314 yds.) from the past two years combined, while freshman Tory Blaylock is a key cog for OU and versatile QB John Mateer. LB Kip Lewis's late INT return for a TD sewed up a Sooners win at Auburn last year in their first-ever SEC triumph.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Florida (1-2) at Miami (3-0). From Hard Rock Stadium. Embattled Gators coach Billy Napier is 0-12 in road games vs. ranked teams entering this Sunshine State clash with No. 4 Miami, winner of eight of the last 10 meetings. Georgia transfer Carson Beck pilots the Hurricanes, while Florida sticks with DJ Lagway despite his 5-INT night in a loss to LSU. Akheem Mesidor heads the UM pass rush.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2022: Florida State vs. LSU in the Louisiana Kickoff Classic in New Orleans. QB Jordan Travis and FSU racked up 406 rushing yards in last week's tune up for this clash in Tigers territory to open the Brian Kelly era. WR Kayshon Boutte stars for LSU.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. programme.title: Symon's Suppers
programme.desc: Michael Symon cooks a Cleveland-style clambake using fresh seafood and a beer mojito with grilled oysters to get the party started.

programme.title: Burgers, Brew & 'Que
programme.desc: Anthony Anderson helps Michael Symon discover some of Chicago's legendary food institutions. Their food tour of the Windy City includes smoked sausages, indulgent burgers, phenomenal pork and rare brews. Later, Michael settles a dispute with a local chef with a sumo-style wrestling match.

programme.title: Burgers, Brew & 'Que
programme.desc: In Queens, Michael Symon gets in touch with his Greek heritage with a lamb and feta cheeseburger, and then he sinks his teeth into an Italian-style burger stuffed with smoky mozzarella and prosciutto.

programme.title: Burgers, Brew & 'Que
programme.desc: n Savannah, Ga., Michael Symon finds a food truck serving up two can't-miss creations: cheeseburger tacos with a house-made beer cheese sauce and a Jamaican jerk fried fish taco with mango salsa and cilantro sour cream. In Seattle, he tries an enormous bone-in pork chop brined for six hours and fired on a grill. Finally, in Phoenix, a smoked lamb sandwich with homemade mint sauce is made by a chef who loves her smoker so much that she's even smoking brownies.

programme.title: Burgers, Brew & 'Que
programme.desc: Michael Symon heads to Charleston, where he smokes a whole hog on a supersized indoor smoke pit and devours a slow-smoked rib-eye steak sandwich complete with melted cheddar and caramelized onions. Then, in Houston, he tries a double beef patty burger that gets the royal treatment with two bacon grilled cheese sandwiches for buns. And finally, in Phoenix, Michael pairs a local brew with coffee-braised beef taco and a duck taco with fried brie and fire-roasted apricot compote.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah arrives at The Great Frederick Fair in Maryland, where he enjoys the Whole Hog, the Crabby Dog and the Cake-a-Dilla; Noah visits New York's Wyoming County Fair and samples the Monster Veggie Wrap, the Mexita and the Exploding Fireball Taffy.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Host Noah Cappe crosses the country in search of wild carnival classics, like a pumped-up corndog at the Porter County Fair and a funnel cake-blooming onion mashup at the Greater Gulf State Fair.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe explores the Great American Foodie Fest in Nevada.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe ventures to the land of cheese for the Wisconsin State Fair and is greeted with the ooey-gooey French Onion Soup'r Stick. The Wisconsin Hot Chicken Bomb is a local variation on fried chicken, and the state's signature cocktail is transformed into the Deep-Fried Old Fashioned dessert. Then Noah is off to Goshen, Ind., for the Elkhart County 4-H Fair. One of the prettiest fairgrounds in Indiana, it's also home to an iconic Indy Burger, a new take on the funnel cake.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey has crossed the country chowing down on some of the best eats American has to offer, and it's time to honor the best of the best by inducting the top five absolute cheesiest dishes in "Man v. Food" history into the Hall of Fame.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb visits Buffalo for a nostalgic twist on the classic Buffalo wing, a melt-in-your-mouth chocolate delicacy and a duel at the deli with the Back-Alley Barrel Sandwich Challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey counts down the most epic wins.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb rides the wave to Virginia Beach, VA, for a street corn fritter-topped burger; a decadent croissant-muffin hybrid; and a dozen-egg duel with the corned beef omelet challenge.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's epicurean expedition takes him to San Jose, CA. His first stop is a unique drive-in for a crispy and golden falafel sandwich. Then, he tackles the Monte Cristo Reeto.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's tasty travels bring him to Manchester, New Hampshire, for an epic portion of barbecue that's served on a shovel at KC's Rib Shack. At local favorite Mr. Mac's Mac and Cheese, he only has eyes for their magnum opus, the Deluxe Cheeseburger.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's eating escapade takes him to Brooklyn, New York, for a barbecue-meets-deli feast, an Italian seafood staple and a spicy shrimp challenge that shakes him to his core.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Featuring five seafood feasts from the Hall of Fame, including Creole gumbo; salmon sandwich with scallion cream cheese; oyster trio; and more.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores the diverse culinary classics of Ecuador's capital city, Quito. The urban cuisine features fried pork and potato cakes, fresh ceviche, sugar-coated roasted peanuts, fish soup, and more.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew is on a culinary adventure, exploring the delightful cuisine of Seville, Spain. He tries delicacies like cured Iberico ham, gazpacho and serranito pork sandwiches.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores legendary hotspots and diverse culinary treasures in Hollywood, California. He highlights classic steak and martinis, Thai steamed whole fish, Armenian flatbread topped with minced beef and Persian ice cream.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew visits Lisbon, Portugal, and takes in the capital city's iconic seafood, pork sandwiches and custard tarts.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: A gastronomical exploration of Salt Lake City's iconic food, including steak tips with mole; scones; and a pastrami burger.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Baltimore Ravens v Detroit Lions (Kick-off 1.15am). Coverage of the week three match at M&T Bank Stadium. These two sides last met back in October 2023 when the Ravens came away with an impressive 38-6 victory. The hosts scored points in every quarter while it took until the fourth quarter for the Lions to get something on the board. The visitors will be looking to improve on a record that has only seen them beat Baltimore once in their history.

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Arizona Cardinals v Seattle Seahawks (Kick-off 1.15am). Coverage of the week four match at State Farm Stadium in Glendale. These two sides met twice last season with the Seahawks coming out on top on both occasions. They met in Seattle at the end of November with the West Coast side winning 16-6 before they faced up again two weeks later at this venue, with the Cardinals losing 30-18 in that meeting.
